subject: Technology
title: The Rise of PC Gaming
description: One-minute skill: The Rise of PC Gaming.

hook.text: Console makers control what games you play. On a PC, you answer to no one.

buildup.text: In the 1990s, PCs became powerful enough to rival and then surpass console graphics.

discovery.text: Games like Doom, StarCraft, and Half-Life offered experiences consoles simply couldn't match.

twist.text: PC gaming was expensive and complicated. You needed to install drivers, tweak settings, and troubleshoot crashes.

climax.text: Despite the hassle, PC gamers embraced the freedom to mod games, build custom rigs, and push boundaries.

punchline.text: PC gaming traded convenience for total control.

quiz.question: What advantage did PC gaming have over consoles?
options: Greater freedom to customize and modify games
